description.text:
We are sold out but there are a limited number of tickets at the door sold on a first come basis.  
Boston Decompression 2015: Mimesis 
mi·me·sis /məˈmēsis,mī-/ noun: mimesis  
1. imitation, in particular. - representation or imitation of the real world in art and literature. - the deliberate imitation of the behavior of one group of people by another as a factor in social change.  Mimesis is a natural and cultural phenomena. It is a duality: primary and duplicate, authentic and replica, original and remix, real and more real? In ancient times Aristotle and Plato argued about Mimesis, specifically as it relates to Art as Imitation. In our modern Internet age we may find ourselves cultivating online doppelgangers – Identity as Imitation - this is cultural Mimesis in action. A phenomena as adept in our digital world as the natural world.   Much of Burner culture tends to acculturate those who don’t know or misunderstand what occurs on the playa. Black Rock City is a temporal zone with a permanence in hearts and minds. This change leads us to create our own representations of these memories beyond photos, with regional events and actions. We duplicate Burning Man culture and effect a social wave of radical creativity and acceptance. Contradicting literary scholar of his day, Oscar Wilde, who wrote – “Life imitates Art far more than Art imitates Life”. Which do you prefer the real or the unreal? Has today’s technology made them virtually interchangeable? Do we create anew or are we continuously recreating? 
  
Join us on Saturday November 7th, 2015, as we explore the abstract and the concrete. Come as you are, or as someone who is something else… bring art, music, talk. Let’s create a commotion - a night of situations that move our feet and our souls – let’s make the moment art. 
TICKETS: $20 online • $30 cash at the door Please note: This is a 21+ event.  
We will have 100 tickets available at the door on a first-come, first-served basis. Doors open at 7pm. 
TICKET PRICING POLICY: Everyone needs to have a ticket for entry but there are a limited number of discounted tickets available. Current and former volunteers, artists, musicians, and performers of Boston Decompression: please see below for the full ticket policy. Everyone is welcome to purchase extra tickets and gift them to others. We also encourage all who are able to pay the full $20 for their ticket to please do so. All funds from Boston Decompression are used to provide grants for artists and to continue having participatory events in the Boston area. 
Online tickets sales will end November 7 at noon.  
Tickets are refundable till Monday, November 2 @ midnight. 
  
GET INVOLVED - WE NEED YOU! 
**************************************** 
VOLUNTEERS
Interested in helping with setup, teardown, or greeting smiling faces? 
Contact: La, Abbie 
volunteers@blackrockeast.com 
**************************************** 
PRESS & PR 
Contact: Fig, May-Lee  
press@blackrockeast.com 
**************************************** 
HAVE PHOTOS YOU WANNA SHARE?  
We're creating a slideshow of photos from this year's Burns — Burning Man, Firefly, Transformus, et al! If you have any photos you wish to share, send them to: photos@blackrockeast.com. 
**************************************** 
Looking to mimic something that hasn't been mentioned? 
INFO DESK 
info@blackrockeast.com 
**************************************** 
  
********* 
MUSIC  
********* 
There are two stages at this event. If you are interested in performing at Decompression please see our submission form: http://ow.ly/T5AGu  
Submission deadline is October 18th. Music performance schedule will be announced in two weeks. 
  
Indoor Bar/Club Stage (open 7pm - 2am) 
  
Garage Stage (open 8pm - 1am) 
  
****** 
ART 
****** 
If you are interested in bringing art to Decompression please see our submission form: http://ow.ly/T5Az6  
Art/VJ/Performances will be announced in two weeks. 
  
***************************************************** 
 
BOSTON DECOMPRESSION TICKET POLICY 
The Boston Decompression planning committee has consistently stood by the policy of “Everyone pays,” including lead organizers, volunteers, artists and performers. Decompression is a community effort, which means that the work and talent of any one individual is considered no greater than that of any other individual. We do not have headliners or art superstars - all who attend are considered participants and as such are expected to contribute what they can, financially as well as artistically. That said, we do acknowledge that not all participants are able to contribute financially to the same extent. To address that, we offer a lower-priced ticket option for artists, performers and volunteers who apply for one. 
  
If you need a lower-priced ticket, and are an artist, performer, or (both pre- and post-event) volunteer for Boston Decompression 2015, 2014, and/or 2013 - please email tickets@blackrockeast.com with your full name and list your contribution. You will receive a unique promotional code for one ticket at $12 (+ a small ticketing fee.) This option will be not be available at the door - it is only for pre-sale tickets.  
 We urge those who are able to please continue paying full ticket price, as revenue from ticket sales is what defrays the cost of Decompression. Our goal is that none of the event organizers will be required to use their personal resources to fund Decompression.   
  
FAQs 
  
Where can I contact the organizer with any questions? 
info@blackrockeast.com 
  
  
FAQs 
  
Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event? 
This event is 21+. Bring your ID.  
  
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? 
No, you may bring a printed ticket or present the ticket on your phone - the QR code on your ticket will be scanned on entry.

mi·me·sis
/məˈmēsis,mī-/

1. imitation, in particular.
- representation or imitation of the real world in art and literature.

description.text:
The Rock Stories series is loosely inspired by the VH1 Storytellers series. Instead of featuring 1 artist, we feature as many as 3. This year's lineup also happens to fall in line with our G-Rock tagline "Emerging, Renowned, Legendary Women in Rock." Our show will feature 3 artists in various stages of their careers who will share their Rock Story and their music. From covers to originals, this show is one that will span the gamut of styles. 
Event Sponsors: Guitar Center, Zildjian, JamSpot  
This is a 21+ event. $10 in advance, $15 at the door  
The Artists: 
Erica Mantone 
It’s unclear whether music seems to find her or each new and ever resilient chapter in her life finds music as a central figure. Nonetheless, Erica Mantone believes that music is omnipresent and an essential life-line in her growing web. Erica began studying voice at the age of 12 and obtained her BA in Music in 2003. She has performed as a soloist for classical, opera, musical theatre, jazz, blues and rock. She has also worked in various choral groups, collaborative projects and as a session and backing vocalist. Erica worked as a booking and promotions manager for local music scenes in Boston, Providence and San Diego.   
Currently, she is working towards achieving her goal of becoming a professional session singer and working with local music legends Emily Grogan, Gino Caira, Suzie Hatton and many more. Now she is happy and proud to begin to find her own voice as a singer songwriter. Erica is fully aware that without the aforementioned people as well a myriad of other music-type people, her family and friends, she would not exist as she does now. Every day she is grateful for this jigsaw puzzle of a life. And Frodo. The most amazing cat that ever lived. 
  
Laurel Blanchard  
Laurel Blanchard has been playing drums for over 40 years. She was in the 70s female funk-rock band Lilith, performing on their album “Boston Ride,” and The Ina Ray Band, recording 2 singles with the 80s female rock band. Laurel then ventured into the punk scene with Lou   Miami and the Kozmetix, who recorded 2 LPs and had 2 of their music videos shown on MTV. She also did studio work with country performer Jess Leary and Boston’s own Liz Borden.  
More recently, Laurel worked with Girl Gang, an all-female oldies rock band from Western MA; James Straight and the Wide Stance, who released a CD of original material in 2013; and Unruly, an all-female trio playing heavy metal! She continues to be a versatile performer and an inspiration to female drummers everywhere. 
  
Christina Alexander 
Christina Alexander was born in Miami, Florida and currently lives a few miles away in Hollywood, Florida.   At age 3, she was a soloist at a wedding where she recalls singing "You Light Up My Life."  As a teenager, Christina had the good fortune to tour much of the United States as worship leader with the Miami District Youth Band (later incarnations would be Exodus 15 and Drive).  She has shared the stage with: Petra, Jars of Clay, Jaci Velasquez, Alice Day, Melba Moore and others.  Her undergraduate degree is in Musical Theater (from Barry University).   
She has toured with Dreamgirls as Lorell, Math Rocks  as KC.  Other stage credits include: Excellent Conquest (Etah/Evol); It Ain't Nothing But the Blues (Gretha); Joe Turner's Come and Gone (Martha Pentecost); Gem of the Ocean (Aunt Ester); Mahalia (Mahalia); A Women Called Truth (Sojourner Truth). This  versatile performer has had the good fortune to travel to several countries singing, acting, and teaching.  Her vocals talents can be heard on many recording projects, both in Voice Over (King Otis and the Kingdom of Goode children's series), and as a featured singer (various albums).   
In 2012, Christina performed with the Alabama Gospel Choir, during their 10th annual European Tour and was named Best Actress by the Miami New Times Best of Miami.  Being also an educator, Christina has worked in the school sectors (private, public, charter, and University) teaching Music and Drama.  Christina is presently the Artistic Director of G-Rock Music and a full-time performing artist.  Her 1-woman play, HATE! An American Love Story, continues to tour the theater and college scene spreading awareness about racial/cultural/relational tolerance and embracing the differences that make us beautiful, special, and integral.

description.text:
Boston Desi Events proudly present you the Biggest Diwali event of the year 
  
 
  
***********************************************************************************&********************* 
BostonDesiEvents.com in association with NEU Grads, BU Grads & Suffolk proudly present the Diwali Dhamaka 2015 invite you to 
******************************************************************************************************************* 
Calling out all Desi's in the Boston Area. Come join us for a fun event with dancing, music and masti (w/Boston's Top Desi Dj's) & guest Dj Punjab on Friday Nov 13th.  
1) Two Floor Night Lounge with an open porch (Spectacular View of Boston Downtown) 
2) Two Open Bars at the Venue 
Dj Rakesh & DJ PUnJab -----Grab your traditional wear and dancing shoes on because Punjab's Bhangra king (DJ Punjab) will rock the floor!!!! 
  
Dj Punjab will be Rocking the House & Playing your favorite Bollywood/Bhangra/EDM/ Desi Item songs & Remixes.  Venue-----  MAST' Lounge 45 Province Street Boston MA 02108 (Boston Downtown).   Time:  Doors open at 10:00 PM. Party goes on until 2AM  Official Photographer - Vaibhav Patel / Nikhil Tanna  
Where:  MAST' Lounge 
45 Province Street 
 Boston MA 02108 (Boston Downtown). 
When: Friday Nov 13th. 
Time: Doors open at 10:00 PM. Party goes on until 2AM 
Full Bar/ Drinks/ 2 Floors & more. 
Music and Entertainment by Dj Punjab & Dj Rakesh on both floors. 
Now with a live Dholi  
 
Advanced tickets provide Guaranteed entry to the event before midnight. 
This is a 21+ event. Proper Mass ID required for entry.  
For tix/ Info and more visit www.Bostondesievents.com . No refunds 
Or contact the Hosts: Ravi/ Hershid/  Mõhåmmedäli / Shantanu / Amit Singh or call / text 617.416.8705

name.text: Brookline High School Class of 1995 Reunion
name.html: Brookline High School Class of 1995 Reunion

description.text: It's been 20 years!  Join us for a night of catching up, showing off, introducing, food, drinks and music at one of the greatest Boston pubs around.  Rock out to some 90's music, appetizers and 1 drink ticket are included with ticket price.
description.html: It's been 20 years!  Join us for a night of catching up, showing off, introducing, food, drinks and music at one of the greatest Boston pubs around.  Rock out to some 90's music, appetizers and 1 drink ticket are included with ticket price.

name.text: Seth B. At The Hard Rock Cafe (Live Showcase)
name.html: Seth B. At The Hard Rock Cafe (Live Showcase)

description.text: I am excited to announce that I have been given the opportunity to perform Live in front of Universal Music Label executives at The Hard Rock Cafe in Boston, and you are invited!  I will only be guaranteed a 10 minute time slot but may be called up again later in the evening for more performance time. The performance will start at 5 PM with multiple performers, but guests are recommended to arrive around 330PM, leaving about 15 minutes for Parking and admission as the event is expected to reach capacity. This is a red carpet event and dress code is strictly enforced. Upscale night club dress only: no tennis shoes, hats, tshirts, hooded sweatshirts, gangster apparel or sportswear will be tolerated.   Tickets are $20 and include a free plus 1 guest!  All guests are REQUIRED to have tickets to attend the event or be on the guest list. The event is 18+.   Please be advised that purchasing tickets in advance is highly encouraged as the event is expected to sell out!  Hope to see you there!

I will only be guaranteed a 10 minute time slot but may be called up again later in the evening for more performance time. The performance will start at 5 PM with multiple performers, but guests are recommended to arrive around 330PM, leaving about 15 minutes for Parking and admission as the event is expected to reach capacity. This is a red carpet event and dress code is strictly enforced. Upscale night club dress only: no tennis shoes, hats, tshirts, hooded sweatshirts, gangster apparel or sportswear will be tolerated. 

Tickets are $20 and include a free plus 1 guest!

All guests are REQUIRED to have tickets to attend the event or be on the guest list. The event is 18+. 

Please be advised that purchasing tickets in advance is highly encouraged as the event is expected to sell out!

Hope to see you there!
